article.title: Outsmart Traffic with Community-Based Navigation App
article.author: Rachel Lilly
article.abstract: Imagine getting alerts from drivers around you in real time. Police officer around the next curve? A broken down vehicle blocking the shoulder? The free community-based app Waze makes it possible by crowdsourcing traffic and road information to provide drivers with the best route.
article.text: Imagine getting alerts from drivers around you in real time. Police officer around the next curve? A broken down vehicle blocking the shoulder? Now, the free community-based Waze app makes it possible by crowdsourcing traffic and road information to provide drivers with the best route. To use the app, you simply type in the destination address and follow the directions (shown on a map and with turn-by-turn voice navigation). While you drive, the app collects traffic and other road data. In addition, users can take an active role by sharing road reports on accidents, police traps, traffic jams, road closures and other hazards. The app uses this data to give drivers a heads up about what lies ahead and to automatically reroute as conditions change. Waze learns your frequent destinations, commuting hours and preferred routes and can help you find the cheapest gas stations. Plus, earn points by contributing road information to climb the ranks in the Waze community.
